attributes.action: ban the noisy Boeing 747-400 from London Heathrow
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
It may be a beautiful and iconic aircraft but it is the leading source
of noise disturbance over London.  It is the only widely used aircraft
rated QC/2 on arrival - which means that it is at least two times more
noisy than newer widebodied jets from Boeing and Airbus.  It makes
around four times more noise than a (shorthaul) Boeing 737-800 on
arrival.  (A full listing of departure and arrival noise ratings can
be found at the Department for Transport website in a PDF file called
"annexdqctable".)

Aircraft noise has been shown to have a serious impact on the
education of children living and going to school beneath flightpaths.

747-400s are used on many longhaul flights from the Far East, some of
which arrive before 5am.

We call on the government to insist that airlines move with the times
and use quieter aircraft on all routes using London Heathrow, thereby
showing respect for the millions of people affected by this blight.

We hope other airports will follow.
